48 
49 // Simple for loop over the species just to make life a little easier
50 #define LOOP(__op__)\
51 for (int i = 0; i < m_ns; ++i) {\
52  __op__ ;\
53 }
54 
55 #define LOOP_ATOMS(__op__)\
56 for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < m_na; ++i) {\
57  j = mp_indices[i];\
58  __op__ ;\
59 }
60 
61 // Loops over molecules. Inside the loop, the index i is zero based and indexes
62 // internal molecular data. The index j is the index corresponding to the
63 // original species data.
64 #define LOOP_MOLECULES(__op__)\
65 for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < m_nm; ++i) {\
66  j = mp_indices[m_na+i];\
67  __op__ ;\
68 }
69 
70 // Loops over heavy particles (non electron species). Inside the loop, index i
71 // is zero based and indexes internal molecular data. The index j is the index
72 // corresponding to the original species data.
73 #define LOOP_HEAVY(__op__)\
74 for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < m_na + m_nm; ++i) {\
75  j = (m_has_electron ? i+1 : i);\
76  __op__ ;\
77 }
78 
79 typedef struct {
80  double ln_omega_t; // ln(omega^(2 / L) * theta)
81  double linearity; // L / 2
82 } RotData;
83 
84 typedef struct {
85  double g; // degeneracy
86  double theta; // characteristic temperature
87 } ElecLevel;
88 
89 typedef struct {
90  unsigned int offset;
91  unsigned int nheavy;
92  unsigned int nlevels;
93  int* p_nelec;
94  ElecLevel* p_levels;
95 } ElectronicData;

103 class RrhoDB : public ThermoDB
104 {
105 public:
106 
107  RrhoDB(int arg)
108  : ThermoDB(298.15, 101325.0), m_ns(0), m_na(0), m_nm(0),
109  m_has_electron(false),
110  m_use_tables(true),
111  m_last_bfacs_T(0.0)
112  { }
113 
117  ~RrhoDB()
118  {
119  delete [] mp_lnqtmw;
120  delete [] mp_hform;
121  delete [] mp_indices;
122  delete [] mp_rot_data;
123  delete [] mp_nvib;
124  delete [] mp_vib_temps;
125 
126  delete [] m_elec_data.p_nelec;
127  delete [] m_elec_data.p_levels;
128  delete [] mp_part_sst;
129  delete [] mp_el_bfacs;
130 
131  if (m_use_tables) {
132  delete mp_el_bfac_table;
133  }
134  }
135 
153  void cp(
154  double Th, double Te, double Tr, double Tv, double Tel,
155  double* const cp, double* const cpt, double* const cpr,
156  double* const cpv, double* const cpel)
157  {
158  // Special case if we only want total Cp
159  if (cp != NULL && cpt == NULL && cpr == NULL && cpv == NULL &&
160  cpel == NULL)
161  {
162  cpT(cp, Eq());
163  cpR(cp, PlusEq());
164  cpV(Tv, cp, PlusEq());
165  cpE(Tel, cp, PlusEq());
166  return;
167  }
168 
169  // Otherwise we have to compute each component directly.
170  // Translation
171  if (cpt == NULL) {
172  if (cp != NULL)
173  //cpT(cp, PlusEq());
174  cpT(cp, Eq());
175  } else {
176  cpT(cpt, Eq());
177  if (cp != NULL)
178  LOOP(cp[i] = cpt[i]);
179  }
180 
181  // Rotation
182  if (cpr == NULL) {
183  if (cp != NULL)
184  cpR(cp, PlusEq());
185  } else {
186  cpR(cpr, Eq());
187  if (cp != NULL)
188  LOOP_MOLECULES(cp[j] += cpr[j]);
189  }
190 
191  // Vibration
192  if (cpv == NULL) {
193  if (cp != NULL)
194  cpV(Tv, cp, PlusEq());
195  } else {
196  cpV(Tv, cpv, Eq());
197  if (cp != NULL)
198  LOOP_MOLECULES(cp[j] += cpv[j]);
199  }
200 
201  // Electronic
202  if (cpel == NULL) {
203  if (cp != NULL)
204  cpE(Tel, cp, PlusEq());
205  } else {
206  cpE(Tel, cpel, Eq());
207  if (cp != NULL)
208  LOOP_HEAVY(cp[j] += cpel[j]);
209  }
210  }
211

213 // * Computes the species vibrational specific heats at the given temperature
214 // * nondimensionalized by Ru.

216 // void cpv(double Tv, double* const p_cpv)
217 // {
218 // int ilevel = 0;
219 // double sum, fac1, fac2;
220 // LOOP_MOLECULES(
221 // sum = 0.0;
222 // for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
223 // fac1 = mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / Tv;
224 // fac2 = std::exp(fac1);
225 // fac1 = fac1 / (fac2 - 1.0);
226 // sum += fac2*fac1;
227 // }
228 // p_cpv[j] = sum;
229 // )
230 // }
231 //
232 // void cpel(double Tel, double* const p_cpel)
233 // {
234 // CpelFunctor()(Tel, p_cpel, m_elec_data, Eq());
235 // }

254  void enthalpy(
255  double Th, double Te, double Tr, double Tv, double Tel, double* const h,
256  double* const ht, double* const hr, double* const hv, double* const hel,
257  double* const hf)
258  {
259 
260  // Special case where we only want the total enthalpy
261  if (ht == NULL && hr == NULL && hv == NULL && hel == NULL &&
262  hf == NULL && h != NULL)
263  {
264  hT(Th, Te, h, Eq());
265  hR(Tr, h, PlusEq());
266  hV(Tv, h, PlusEq());
267  hE(Tel, h, PlusEq());
268  hF(h, PlusEq());
269  LOOP(h[i] /= Th);
270  return;
271  }
272 
273  // Otherwise selectively choose what we want
274  // Translational enthalpy
275  if (ht == NULL) {
276  //hT(Th, Te, h, Eq());
277  if (h != NULL)
278  hT(Th, Te, h, EqDiv(Th));
279  } else {
280  hT(Th, Te, ht, EqDiv(Th));
281  if (h != NULL)
282  LOOP(h[i] = ht[i]);
283  }
284 
285  // Rotatonal enthalpy
286  if (hr == NULL) {
287  if (h != NULL)
288  hR(Tr, h, PlusEqDiv(Th));
289  } else {
290  LOOP(hr[i] = 0.0);
291  hR(Tr, hr, EqDiv(Th));
292  if (h != NULL)
293  LOOP_MOLECULES(h[j] += hr[j]);
294  }
295 
296  // Vibrational enthalpy
297  if (hv == NULL) {
298  if (h != NULL)
299  hV(Tv, h, PlusEqDiv(Th));
300  } else {
301  LOOP(hv[i] = 0.0);
302  hV(Tv, hv, EqDiv(Th));
303  if (h != NULL)
304  LOOP_MOLECULES(h[j] += hv[j]);
305  }
306 
307  // Electronic enthalpy
308  if (hel == NULL) {
309  if (h != NULL)
310  hE(Tel, h, PlusEqDiv(Th));
311  } else {
312  LOOP(hel[i] = 0.0);
313  hE(Tel, hel, EqDiv(Th));
314  if (h != NULL)
315  LOOP(h[i] += hel[i]);
316  }
317 
318  // Formation enthalpy
319  if (hf == NULL) {
320  if (h != NULL)
321  hF(h, PlusEqDiv(Th));
322  } else {
323  hF(hf, EqDiv(Th));
324  if (h != NULL)
325  LOOP(h[i] += hf[i]);
326  }
327  }
328 
329 // void hv(double Tv, double* const p_hv)
330 // {
331 // int ilevel = 0;
332 // double sum, fac1;
333 // LOOP_MOLECULES(
334 // sum = 0.0;
335 // for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
336 // fac1 = mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / Tv;
337 // sum += fac1 / (std::exp(fac1) - 1.0);
338 // }
339 // p_hv[j] = sum;
340 // )
341 // }
342 //
343 // void hel(double Tel, double* const p_hel)
344 // {
345 // HelFunctor()(Tel, p_hel, m_elec_data, Eq());
346 // }
347 
363  void entropy(
364  double Th, double Te, double Tr, double Tv, double Tel, double P,
365  double* const s, double* const st, double* const sr, double* const sv,
366  double* const sel)
367  {
368  // Special case where we only want the total entropy
369  if (st == NULL && sr == NULL && sv == NULL && sel == NULL) {
370  sT(Th, Te, P, s, Eq());
371  sR(Tr, s, PlusEq());
372  sV(Tv, s, PlusEq());
373  sE(Tel, s, PlusEq());
374 
375  // Include spin contribution for free electron entropy
376  if (m_has_electron)
377  s[0] += std::log(2.0);
378 
379  return;
380  }
381 
382  // Otherwise collect individual components
383  // Translational entropy
384  if (st == NULL)
385  sT(Th, Te, P, s, Eq());
386  else {
387  sT(Th, Te, P, st, Eq());
388  LOOP(s[i] = st[i]);
389  }
390 
391  // Rotational entropy
392  if (sr == NULL)
393  sR(Tr, s, PlusEq());
394  else {
395  LOOP(sr[i] = 0.0);
396  sR(Tr, sr, Eq());
397  LOOP_MOLECULES(s[j] += sr[j]);
398  }
399 
400  // Vibrational entropy
401  if (sv == NULL)
402  sV(Tv, s, PlusEq());
403  else {
404  LOOP(sv[i] = 0.0);
405  sV(Tv, sv, Eq());
406  LOOP_MOLECULES(s[j] += sv[j]);
407  }
408 
409  // Electronic entropy
410  if (sel == NULL)
411  sE(Tel, s, PlusEq());
412  else {
413  LOOP(sel[i] = 0.0);
414  sE(Tel, sel, Eq());
415  LOOP(s[i] += sel[i]);
416  }
417 
418  // Include spin contribution for free electron entropy
419  if (m_has_electron)
420  s[0] += std::log(2.0);
421  }
422 
431  void gibbs(
432  double Th, double Te, double Tr, double Tv, double Tel, double P,
433  double* const g, double* const gt, double* const gr, double* const gv,
434  double* const gel)
435  {
436  // First compute the non-dimensional enthalpy
437  enthalpy(Th, Te, Tr, Tv, Tel, g, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
438 
439  // Subtract the entropies
440  sT(Th, Te, P, g, MinusEq());
441  sR(Tr, g, MinusEq());
442  sV(Tv, g, MinusEq());
443  sE(Tel, g, MinusEq());
444 
445  // Account for spin of free electrons
446  if (m_has_electron)
447  g[0] -= std::log(2.0);
448  }
449 
450 private:
451 
452  typedef Equals<double> Eq;
453  typedef EqualsYDivAlpha<double> EqDiv;
454  typedef PlusEqualsYDivAlpha<double> PlusEqDiv;
455  typedef PlusEquals<double> PlusEq;
456  typedef MinusEquals<double> MinusEq;
457 
458  class ElecBFacsFunctor
459  {
460  public:
461  typedef ElectronicData DataProvider;
462 
463  void operator() (double T, double* p_f, const DataProvider& data) const
464  {
465  (*this)(T, p_f, data, Equals<double>());
466  }
467 
468  template <typename OP>
469  void operator () (
470  double T, double* p_f, const DataProvider& data, const OP& op) const
471  {
472  double fac;
473  int ilevel = 0;
474 
475  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < data.nheavy; ++i) {
476  p_f[3*i+0] = 0.0;
477  p_f[3*i+1] = 0.0;
478  p_f[3*i+2] = 0.0;
479 
480  for (int k = 0; k < data.p_nelec[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
481  fac = data.p_levels[ilevel].g *
482  std::exp(-data.p_levels[ilevel].theta / T);
483  p_f[3*i+0] += fac;
484  p_f[3*i+1] += fac * data.p_levels[ilevel].theta;
485  p_f[3*i+2] += fac * data.p_levels[ilevel].theta *
486  data.p_levels[ilevel].theta;
487  }
488  }
489  }
490  };
491 
492 protected:
493 
497  virtual void loadAvailableSpecies(std::list<Species>& species)
498  {
499  IO::XmlDocument species_doc(databaseFileName("species.xml", "thermo"));
500  IO::XmlElement::const_iterator species_iter = species_doc.root().begin();
501 
502  for ( ; species_iter != species_doc.root().end(); ++species_iter) {
503  // Add the species to the list
504  species.push_back(*species_iter);
505 
506  // We can also add all of the excited states as implicitly defined
507  // species
508  IO::XmlElement::const_iterator rrho_iter =
509  species_iter->findTagWithAttribute(
510  "thermodynamics", "type", "RRHO");
511 
512  if (rrho_iter == species_iter->end())
513  continue;
514 
515  Species& ground_state = species.back();
516  ParticleRRHO rrho(*rrho_iter);
517  for (size_t i = 0; i < rrho.nElectronicLevels(); ++i)
518  species.push_back(Species(ground_state, i));
519  }
520  }
521 
525  virtual void loadThermodynamicData()
526  {
527  m_ns = species().size();
528  m_has_electron = (species()[0].type() == ELECTRON);
529 
530  // Load the RRHO models for each of the needed species
531  IO::XmlDocument species_doc(databaseFileName("species.xml", "thermo"));
532 
533  vector<ParticleRRHO> rrhos;
534  map<std::string, const ParticleRRHO*> to_expand;
535 
536  for (int i = 0; i < m_ns; ++i) {
537  if (species()[i].name() == species()[i].groundStateName()) {
538  rrhos.push_back(*(species_doc.root().findTagWithAttribute(
539  "species", "name", species()[i].groundStateName())->
540  findTagWithAttribute("thermodynamics", "type", "RRHO")));
541  }
542  else {
543  const ParticleRRHO* p_rrho = to_expand[species()[i].groundStateName()];
544  if (p_rrho == NULL) {
545  p_rrho = new ParticleRRHO(
546  *(species_doc.root().findTagWithAttribute(
547  "species", "name", species()[i].groundStateName())->
548  findTagWithAttribute("thermodynamics", "type", "RRHO")));
549  to_expand[species()[i].groundStateName()] = p_rrho;
550  }
551 
552  rrhos.push_back(ParticleRRHO(*p_rrho, species()[i].level()));
553  }
554  }
555 
556  map<std::string, const ParticleRRHO*>::iterator iter =
557  to_expand.begin();
558  while (iter != to_expand.end()) {
559  delete iter->second;
560  iter++;
561  }
562 
563  // Determine the number and indices of the atoms and molecules
564  vector<int> atom_indices;
565  vector<int> molecule_indices;
566 
567  LOOP(
568  switch(species()[i].type()) {
569  case ATOM:
570  atom_indices.push_back(i);
571  break;
572  case MOLECULE:
573  molecule_indices.push_back(i);
574  break;
575  default:
576  break;
577  }
578  )
579 
580  m_na = atom_indices.size();
581  m_nm = molecule_indices.size();
582 
583  // Order the atoms first followed by the molecules
584  mp_indices = new int [m_na + m_nm];
585  copy(atom_indices.begin(), atom_indices.end(), mp_indices);
586  copy(molecule_indices.begin(), molecule_indices.end(), mp_indices+m_na);
587 
588  // Store the species constants found in the translational entropy term
589  mp_lnqtmw = new double [m_ns];
590  double qt = 2.5*std::log(KB) + 1.5*std::log(TWOPI/(NA*HP*HP));
591  LOOP(mp_lnqtmw[i] = qt + 1.5*std::log(species()[i].molecularWeight()))
592 
593  // Store the species formation enthalpies in K
594  mp_hform = new double [m_ns];
595  LOOP(mp_hform[i] = rrhos[i].formationEnthalpy() / RU)
596 
597  // Store the molecule's rotational energy parameters
598  mp_rot_data = new RotData [m_nm];
599  LOOP_MOLECULES(
600  const ParticleRRHO& rrho = rrhos[j];
601  int linear = rrho.linearity();
602  mp_rot_data[i].linearity = linear / 2.0;
603  mp_rot_data[i].ln_omega_t =
604  std::log(rrho.rotationalTemperature()) + 2.0 / linear *
605  std::log(rrho.stericFactor());
606  )
607 
608  // Store the vibrational temperatures of all the molecules in a compact
609  // form
610  mp_nvib = new int [m_nm];
611  int nvib = 0;
612  LOOP_MOLECULES(
613  mp_nvib[i] = rrhos[j].nVibrationalLevels();
614  nvib += mp_nvib[i];
615  )
616 
617  mp_vib_temps = new double [nvib];
618  int itemp = 0;
619  LOOP_MOLECULES(
620  const ParticleRRHO& rrho = rrhos[j];
621  for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, itemp++)
622  mp_vib_temps[itemp] = rrho.vibrationalEnergy(k);
623  )
624 
625  // Finally store the electronic energy levels in a compact form like the
626  // vibrational energy levels
627  m_elec_data.p_nelec = new int [m_na + m_nm];
628  m_elec_data.nlevels = 0;
629  LOOP_HEAVY(
630  m_elec_data.p_nelec[i] = rrhos[j].nElectronicLevels();
631  m_elec_data.nlevels += m_elec_data.p_nelec[i];
632  )
633 
634  m_elec_data.p_levels = new ElecLevel [m_elec_data.nlevels];
635  int ilevel = 0;
636  LOOP_HEAVY(
637  const ParticleRRHO& rrho = rrhos[j];
638  for (int k = 0; k < m_elec_data.p_nelec[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
639  m_elec_data.p_levels[ilevel].g =
640  rrho.electronicEnergy(k).first;
641  m_elec_data.p_levels[ilevel].theta =
642  rrho.electronicEnergy(k).second;
643  }
644  )
645 
646  m_elec_data.offset = (m_has_electron ? 1 : 0);
647  m_elec_data.nheavy = m_na + m_nm;
648 
649  if (m_use_tables) {
650  mp_el_bfac_table = new Mutation::Utilities::LookupTable
651  <double, double, ElecBFacsFunctor>(
652  50.0, 50000.0, 3*(m_na+m_nm), m_elec_data, 0.005);
653  }
654 
655  mp_el_bfacs = new double [3*(m_na+m_nm)];
656 
657  // Compute the contribution of the partition functions at the standard
658  // state temperature to the species enthalpies
659  mp_part_sst = new double [m_ns];
660  double Tss = standardTemperature();
661  hT(Tss, Tss, mp_part_sst, Eq());
662  hR(Tss, mp_part_sst, PlusEq());
663  hV(Tss, mp_part_sst, PlusEq());
664  hE(Tss, mp_part_sst, PlusEq());
665  }
666 
667 private:
668 
669  void updateElecBoltzmannFactors(double T)
670  {
671  if (std::abs(1.0 - m_last_bfacs_T / T) < 1.0e-16)
672  return;
673 
674  if (m_use_tables)
675  mp_el_bfac_table->lookup(T, mp_el_bfacs);
676  else
677  ElecBFacsFunctor()(T, mp_el_bfacs, m_elec_data);
678 
679  m_last_bfacs_T = T;
680  }
681 
682 
686  template <typename OP>
687  void cpT(double* const cp, const OP& op) {
688  LOOP(op(cp[i], 2.5));
689  }
690 
694  template <typename OP>
695  void cpR(double* const cp, const OP& op) {
696  op(cp[0], 0.0);
697  LOOP_ATOMS(op(cp[j], 0.0));
698  LOOP_MOLECULES(op(cp[j], mp_rot_data[i].linearity));
699  }
700 
704  template <typename OP>
705  void cpV(double Tv, double* const cp, const OP& op) {
706  int ilevel = 0;
707  double sum, fac1, fac2;
708  op(cp[0], 0.0);
709  LOOP_ATOMS(op(cp[j], 0.0));
710  LOOP_MOLECULES(
711  sum = 0.0;
712  for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
713  fac1 = mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / Tv;
714  fac2 = std::exp(fac1);
715  fac1 *= fac1*fac2;
716  fac2 -= 1.0;
717  sum += fac1/(fac2*fac2);
718  }
719  op(cp[j], sum);
720  )
721  }
722 
727  template <typename OP>
728  void cpE(double T, double* const p_cp, const OP& op)
729  {
730  updateElecBoltzmannFactors(T);
731  op(p_cp[0], 0.0);
732 
733  double* facs = mp_el_bfacs;
734  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_elec_data.nheavy; ++i, facs += 3) {
735  if (m_elec_data.p_nelec[i] > 1)
736  op(p_cp[i+m_elec_data.offset],
737  (facs[2]*facs[0]-facs[1]*facs[1])/(T*T*facs[0]*facs[0]));
738  else
739  op(p_cp[i+m_elec_data.offset], 0.0);
740  }
741  }
742 
743 
747  template <typename OP>
748  void hT(double T, double Te, double* const h, const OP& op) {
749  if (m_has_electron)
750  op(h[0], 2.5 * Te);
751  LOOP_HEAVY(op(h[j], 2.5 * T))
752  }
753 
757  template <typename OP>
758  void hR(double T, double* const h, const OP& op) {
759  LOOP_MOLECULES(op(h[j], mp_rot_data[i].linearity * T))
760  }
761 
765  template <typename OP>
766  void hV(double T, double* const h, const OP& op) {
767  if (T < 10.0) {
768  LOOP_MOLECULES(op(h[j], 0.0));
769  } else {
770  int ilevel = 0;
771  double sum;
772  LOOP_MOLECULES(
773  sum = 0.0;
774  for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, ilevel++)
775  sum += mp_vib_temps[ilevel] /
776  (std::exp(mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / T) - 1.0);
777  op(h[j], sum);
778  )
779  }
780  }
781 
786  template <typename OP>
787  void hE(double T, double* const p_h, const OP& op)
788  {
789  updateElecBoltzmannFactors(T);
790  op(p_h[0], 0.0);
791 
792  double* facs = mp_el_bfacs;
793  for (int i = 0; i < m_elec_data.nheavy; ++i, facs += 3) {
794  if (facs[0] > 0)
795  op(p_h[i+m_elec_data.offset], facs[1]/facs[0]);
796  else
797  op(p_h[i+m_elec_data.offset], 0.0);
798  }
799  }
800 
804  template <typename OP>
805  void hF(double* const h, const OP& op) {
806  LOOP(op(h[i], mp_hform[i] - mp_part_sst[i]))
807  }
808 
812  template <typename OP>
813  void sT(double Th, double Te, double P, double* const s, const OP& op) {
814  double fac = 2.5 * (1.0 + std::log(Th)) - std::log(P);
815  if (m_has_electron)
816  op(s[0], 2.5 * std::log(Te / Th) + fac + mp_lnqtmw[0]);
817  for (int i = (m_has_electron ? 1 : 0); i < m_ns; ++i)
818  op(s[i], fac + mp_lnqtmw[i]);
819  }
820 
824  template <typename OP>
825  void sR(double T, double* const s, const OP& op) {
826  const double onelnT = 1.0 + std::log(T);
827  LOOP_MOLECULES(
828  op(s[j], mp_rot_data[i].linearity * (onelnT -
829  mp_rot_data[i].ln_omega_t));
830  )
831  }
832 
836  template <typename OP>
837  void sV(double T, double* const s, const OP& op) {
838  int ilevel = 0;
839  double fac, sum1, sum2;
840  LOOP_MOLECULES(
841  sum1 = sum2 = 0.0;
842  for (int k = 0; k < mp_nvib[i]; ++k, ilevel++) {
843  fac = std::exp(mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / T);
844  sum1 += mp_vib_temps[ilevel] / (fac - 1.0);
845  sum2 += std::log(1.0 - 1.0 / fac);
846  }
847  op(s[j], (sum1 / T - sum2));
848  )
849  }
850 
854  template <typename OP>
855  void sE(double T, double* const p_s, const OP& op) {
856  updateElecBoltzmannFactors(T);
857  op(p_s[0], 0.0);
858 
859  double* facs = mp_el_bfacs;
860  for (int i = 0; i < m_elec_data.nheavy; ++i, facs += 3) {
861  if (facs[0] > 0)
862  op(p_s[i+m_elec_data.offset],
863  (facs[1]/(facs[0]*T) + std::log(facs[0])));
864  else
865  op(p_s[i+m_elec_data.offset], 0.0);
866  }
867  }
868 
869 private:
870 
871  int m_ns;
872  int m_na;
873  int m_nm;
874 
875  bool m_has_electron;
876  bool m_use_tables;
877 
878  double* mp_lnqtmw;
879  double* mp_hform;
880  double* mp_part_sst;
881 
882  int* mp_indices;
883  RotData* mp_rot_data;
884 
885  int* mp_nvib;
886  double* mp_vib_temps;
887 
888  ElectronicData m_elec_data;
889  Mutation::Utilities::LookupTable<double, double, ElecBFacsFunctor>* mp_el_bfac_table;
890  double* mp_el_bfacs;
891  double m_last_bfacs_T;
892 
893  //Mutation::Utilities::LookupTable<double, double, HelFunctor>* mp_hel_table;
894  //Mutation::Utilities::LookupTable<double, double, SelFunctor>* mp_sel_table;
895  //Mutation::Utilities::LookupTable<double, double, CpelFunctor>* mp_cpel_table;
896 
897 }; // class RrhoDB
898 
899 #undef LOOP
900 #undef LOOP_HEAVY
901 #undef LOOP_MOLECULES
902 
903 // Register the RRHO model with the other thermodynamic databases
904 Utilities::Config::ObjectProvider<RrhoDB, ThermoDB> rrhoDB("RRHO");
905 
906  } // namespace Thermodynamics
907 } // namespace Mutation
